importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of publication indicates when the news of Doug Martin's death was reported to the public, signaling public awareness and media coverage of the tragic incident.

The date corresponds to the day the Oakland Police Department and officials released their statement regarding the arrest and death of Doug Martin, which underscores the timing of public and institutional response.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The timeline indicates that the incident occurred on Saturday, June 2025, and was reported publicly on October 20, 2025, highlighting the span from the event to the public announcement.

keyTakeAways: Doug Martin, a former All-Pro NFL running back, died after being taken into custody during a break-in investigation in Oakland, California.
Martin had a distinguished career with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, including being named first-team All-Pro and selected to the Pro Bowl twice.
His death is linked to mental health struggles, with his former agent stating that mental illness 'proved to be the one opponent from which Doug could not run'.
The incident occurred when Martin, overwhelmed and disoriented, fled his home and entered a neighbor's home, leading to his arrest and subsequent death.
Martin, originally from Oakland, lived in Stockton and is remembered as a prominent figure in both local and national sports history.
Multiple agencies, including the Oakland Police Department, city mayor, and Alameda County Coroner, are involved in the investigation and response.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Doug Martin, a former All-Pro NFL running back best known for his time with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, died on Saturday, June 2025, after being taken into custody by Oakland police during an investigation into a break-in. He was reportedly overwhelmed and disoriented, fled his home in Stockton, and entered a neighbor’s home, leading to his arrest. A brief struggle occurred during the arrest, and he later died in a hospital after being transported by paramedics. The cause of death has not been released, and an autopsy is underway. His former agent, Brian Murphy, revealed that Martin privately struggled with serious mental health challenges, which significantly impacted his life. The Oakland Police Department, city mayor Barbara Lee, and Alameda County Coroner’s Office are involved in the investigation. Martin, originally from Oakland, was a top 50 player in Buccaneers franchise history and a standout performer in the NFL, including multiple Pro Bowl selections and All-Pro honors.
title: Former NFL Star Doug Martin Dies After Arrest in Oakland Break-In Investigation
